article.description: Iverson Fleming scored a season-high 17 points and LIU Brooklyn defeated UMass Lowell 84-72 on Thursday night.
article.headline: LIU Brooklyn beats UMass Lowell 84-72
article.story: NEW YORK -- Iverson Fleming scored a season-high 17 points and LIU Brooklyn defeated UMass Lowell 84-72 on Thursday night. Joel Hernandez and Jerome Frink both added 16 points and eight rebounds. Aakim Saintil scored 13 points for the Blackbirds (4-2), who snapped a two-game losing streak in ending a two-game winning streak for the River Hawks (3-3). LIU Brooklyn hit 12 of 26 attempts from the arc, the most 3-pointers for the Blackbirds since December 2013. The River Hawks came in as the America East's leader for 3-point field-goal percentage at 40.7 but only made 5 of 21 for 23.8 percent Thursday. Keith Hayes II had a season-high 20 points for UMass Lowell. Tyler Livingston added 12. LIU led virtually the entire game, was up by seven at halftime and 22 with 16:53 left. The River Hawks got as close as seven in the second half.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
